title: Issues with Last Update
comment: The last update broke http authentication. Was working perfectly for me until recently.

title: Best client I've used for TTRSS
comment: Works well, and developer quickly fixed "crash on open" bug which seems to be particular to a subset of Samsung devices.
Should be fixed with the bugfix release.
Solid client

title: Good
comment: Would like a mode that shows unread first then read after that. Also I don't like having an icon next to every line, maybe a bit of color or background texture is enough subtlety is best.   Also swiping between articles sucks, since it does move like a "real material"
New update messed up Mark Feed Read Button.  Marks ALL articles read, instead of the folder your in
Should be fixed with the bugfix release.
Like the new subtle transition anims

title: Solid performer
comment: Even with occasional the quirks, it works very well for me. Thank you

title: Great tt-rss client
comment: All the features I want and need. I just wish the back button in the header bar was wider. It's very slender and hard to touch on both my s3 and Nexus 7.

title: Great client for Tiny Tiny RSS
comment: This is an excellent client for Tiny Tiny RSS. It gets frequent updates and has a lot of nice features. Recommended!

title: Perfect
comment: Simple and reliable, has all that is needed for rss reading.

title: Fullfeatured but VERY SLOW and VERY unstable
comment: At least for a reasonably big list of feeds

title: Ugly and dangerous
comment: The largest button in the app marks every article as read without a confirmation or undo. The articles themselves look bad, especially the dark gray background on the black headline text. Article navigation is also clumsy.
This button is more dangerous than you think. It might even occasionally bite your finger off.

title: Ttrss reader
comment: I like that reader u install this u also like this

title: Good reader for ttrss
comment: The only feature missing are virtual feeds for folders. Like we can get from the web ttrss. Edit: long press on categories and Show all articles. Cool.
Excellent Companion App

title: Nice but online mandatory
comment: A lot of nice functionalities. But miss something important : synchronisation. For now, this client need to be connected for each move in the app, or launch a big (and long) synchro for everything. So it is slow and not subway proof...

title: Fixed
comment: Cant open entries. It crashes

title: Bad networking kills
comment: Constant lags and slow loading regardless of the network quality. Really pity, because the UI is good enough.

title: Great free app
comment: After the demise of Google reader, I as many other people started looking for a device wide solution to follow my favourite sites. This app made this possible on my android device, and it also comes with a constant stream of updates and new features!

title: Good app
comment: Great app! Does everything I need it to.
gooood

title: Broken
comment: Most recent update breaks all functionality. Cannot view any articles without crashing

title: Decent so far.. with a big caveat
comment: I haven't been using this for more than a few days yet, but the main problem I've run up against is that when I try to add a label to an article, I apparently have too many labels to select from, and the overlay with the checkboxes doesn't seem to be scrollable. This effectively makes it so that I can't organize/tag posts, rendering the app unusable to me. Shame, otherwise I would be using this when on the go.  UPDATE: I submitted a bug report and the dev fixed the label problem (in a minimal way). Nice!

title: Very Good
comment: Nice interface, fairly reliable. Usually have to flush database after changing subscriptions though.

title: Really good
comment: It almost makes up for Google Reader being killed. Of course, running your own server isn't for everyone.  Unlike the "official" TT-RSS client, this one doesn't try to trick you into buying something that is GPL'ed. (Why can't the other one just have a donate option instead of a stupid trial with mandatory unlock key?  What is this, 1996?)
Great App

title: Good app. Bad update
comment: Love this app, but the new update crashes on launch.  Thanks. The update to the update fixed the crash.
Sry about that, the next update is already published and should be rolled out any minute.

title: Excellent
comment: Fills all my requirements and is updated frequently, with care for the users. Thanks a lot!

title: Not Dead with Kit Kat
comment: I can now use this app with Android 4.4. This was cleared up within 7 days. Thanks Nils for the quick updates!
It should work again with the latest update.
Not perfect, but does the job adequately with a private instance of tt-rss server

title: This + TTRSS = AWESOME!
comment: This was a 5 star but reduced to 3. EDIT: Back up to 5 stars again! Can now disable the split screen so it's usable again on phone and tablet. Keep up the great work! So glad Google Reader closed down, much better running my own!

You may want to stay with a non-free app since you request support and features like you payed for it. I do this for fun, please keep this in mind. Also I keep writing anywhere that you can reach me by mail or the bugtracker, where did I make this NOT clear enough for you?

title: Awesome
comment: Great app with consistent updates

This problem should be fixed with the next update. Please report bugs on the bugtracker or via mail and keep in mind that without knowing what android version you are using mostly I can't do anything about your problem.

title: Pmg
comment: Cool

title: great app
comment: great app with constant updates!

This problem should be fixed with the next update. Please report bugs on the bugtracker or via mail and keep in mind that without knowing what android version you are using mostly I can't do anything about your problem.

title: Great app
comment: An option to remove preview pane would be nice. The Nexus 7 doesn't have much real estate for it.

title: Good but a bit buggy
comment: Could pls return mark unread button? Also refresh doesn't work in list of articles but works in main list

title: Excellent!
comment: great app, how about a tablet version?

title: No support for OTP
comment: Two factor authentication would earn 5 stars.

title: labels?
comment: very good so far, but missing the ability to assign labels (or the feature is very well hidden)

title: Awesome app
comment: Better than the "official" one.

title: Excellent
comment: The latest version addresses every shortcoming I felt this app had in the past. Great reader.

title: If you use tiny tiny rss
comment: If you use tiny tiny rss, this app is for you. Perfect in any sense.

title: It is Free
comment: It works well enough for a Free App. The new unread items seem to get sorted randomly amongst the existing ones. But they are there to be found.

title: Mark as read at random
comment: I am not sure of there is a pattern but it looks like the app mark items as read without open them.
No it doesn't. If it does please file a report in our bugtracking system.

title: Love it
comment: Working great...   The only thing I miss is hiding feeds with all read...

title: Missing a proper widget
comment: Love this application, but what's missing is a desktop widget to check the feeds on desktop.

title: Pretty amazing
comment: I find this better than the official app as it works with my podcasts which while not as good as Google listen is still nice to have. I think that any issues with podcasts are related to my player would be nice to have an in app podcast player?

title: Better and better
comment: ..with each release. Simple, free and open source - what's not to love? If something is missing, add it yourself!
Crashes on start

title: Ok
comment: Ok, it would be cooler if we can make this as close to Google Reader app as possible

title: Coming along nicely
comment: It'd be nice to see smooth sweeping between articles. Also, a way to see all articles under a tag, instead of nested lists of feeds.

title: Excellent ttrss reader!
comment: Some minor stability issues (could be my phone), but works well. I would like to have more control over the display theming - links are displayed in red which is a bit annoying. Otherwise I find it a joy to use.

title: Excellent
comment: Far better than it's concurrents, category views included. Nice !  Thanks

title: Good
comment: So far I like this better than the official client. It's the closest thing I've seen to the Google Reader app. It doesn't seem to differentiate between read and unread articles though.

title: Awesome
comment: I love this app, works great, looks beautiful and tasker support.  Only thing I would love to see is a simple 1x1 "unread count" widget.

title: Very nice
comment: Much better than the official client.

title: It's got potential.
comment: It certainly has potential but it has a few quirks that let it down.  Firstly, the error messages, it will of course have the odd issue interacting with our servers but forcing the user to acknowledge the errors is clumsy and annoying. It should be a debug option.  Sweeping articles, needs to be fluid and smooth, also forcing the user to sweep the bottom of the screen is awkward considering how most of us hold our phones. The caching process needs to be more verbose. A higher DPI on UI elements.
I'm not a graphics gui, I write code. If you want to provide high-res images you're welcome.

title: Pretty but too buggy
comment: Much prettier than the official client. But too buggy to use at times. I keep getting errors

title: Good but
comment: It's more comfortable and pretty than official tt-rss client, but it also has more bugs

title: Unexpectedly stopping
comment: Buggy...

title: Nicer interface than official app, a little buggy
comment: This looks prettier than the official app. Sometimes the articles fetched for a feed doesn't match the new articles count until after a manual refresh. Swiping next/prev article doesn't work on my device. Offline support seems a little better than the official app, but sometimes a bit mysterious -- switching between offline and online doesn't give you much feedback as to how long it's going to take to cache articles. The action bar buttons are unlabeled, and it's not necessarily obvious what each of them will do.
Knock off

title: Great
comment: Great app for carrying your cached RSS when disconnected. Worth a donation. Just a glitch: anybody getting 'unknown method' errors?
a few wrinkles, but I find it indispensable nevertheless

title: Shiny
comment: A little glitchy but works well overall. Thanks!

title: Almost perfect
comment: Fantastic in every single way except that I wish it would update regularly in the background instead of just at launch. Otherwise it's great!
Works great with server 1.5.5

title: Love it
comment: Love it :) does what it says, sometimes a bit buggy but there are bugfix releases.. been using it for a while and really like it

title: Great app, but missing labels
comment: Very usable, rivals Google Reader and its associated app. Only thing missing is the 'labels' functionality from the online service.
Great app. Responsive dev. Only thing i could ask for is an updated UI (something like NewsRoom).
After help from the dev, got it working and loving it! Great work!
Unfortunately it just crashing after start. Desire HD
Just what I was looking for. Nils is a great dev!
article count on categories now seems accurate, but for individual feeds is still off. Updates seem faster! Is a star feature possible?
